member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerFactory.GetHISPlayerInterface
member.summary: Creates an instance of HisPlayerInterface for the currently selected platform. This allows to use one API for all the supported platforms. It's recommended to use this and not instantiate directly a class that extends HisPlayerInterface.

member.name: P:HISPlayerAPI.StreamProperties.EnableRendering
member.summary: Toggle render-nonRender of the stream

member.name: P:HISPlayerAPI.StreamProperties.FlipTextureVertically
member.summary: Flip the texture of the stream vertically when it's created Only supported on Android

member.name: T:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerManager
member.summary: HISPlayerManager_Event, class dedicated to contain all the information and architecture related with the events. These events will get information from the plugin internally and they're going to be received in the customer side

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerManager._HISPlayer
member.summary: Reference to the HISPlayerInterface

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerManager.InitHISPlayer
member.summary: Initializes HISPlayerInterface, but not the video content

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerManager.CreatePlayerInterface
member.summary: Creates the respective platform player

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.coroutineHelper
member.summary: Allow tHIS wrapper to use Coroutines from Unity without extends from MonoBehaviour

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface._listeningEvents
member.summary: Handle the loop of the HandleEvents. Each platform decides when to call HandleEvents coroutine and when finish it with '_listeningEvents = false'

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface._listeningErrors
member.summary: Handle the loop of the HandleErrors. Each platform decides when to call HandleErrors coroutine and when finish it with '_listeningErrors = false'

member.summary: MultiView attributes

member.summary: Determines if there is an XR device being used

member.summary: Initialize the video stream from the data stored in HISPlayerManager.cs

member.summary: Release everything internally

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.AddVideoContent(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Add new content to a certain player given the url. If enableDRM variable is true, a video content with empty license will be added.

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.AddVideoContent(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add new content to a certain player given the url and its respective key server uri. enableDRM variable must be true for using tHIS function.

member.summary: Remove a certain url form a certain player's url list

member.summary: Remove a certain stream

member.name: T:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface._OnEventReceived
member.summary: Delegate to be used externally tHIS script. HISPlayerManager will use tHIS delegate to add and remove events of HISPlayerInterface

member.summary: Event to be used with the delegate

member.summary: Remove a callback from the event delegate

member.summary: Use the event delegate internally

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.HandleEvent
member.summary: Handle the eventqueue of the respective platform Prepared to call it wherever it's needeed. In general, it should be called at the end of SetUpPlayer function.

member.summary: Process the next event inside the respective platform

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.isEventInQueue
member.summary: Check if the event queue has events
member.returns: True - in case of contain events

member.summary: Delegate to be used externally this script. HisPlayerManager will use this delegate to add and remove error-events of HisPlayerInterface

member.summary: Error to be used with the delegate

member.summary: Add a new callback to the error-event delegate

member.summary: Remove a callback from the error-event delegate

member.summary: Use the error-event delegate internally

member.summary: Handle the error-event queue of the respective platform Prepared to call it wherever it's needeed. In general, it should be called at the end of SetUpPlayer function.

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.ProcessNextError
member.summary: Process the next event inside the respective platform

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.isErrorInQueue
member.summary: Check if the error queue has events

member.summary: Clean the texture of the stream element of choice with designated color.

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface._enableDecodedFramesBuffer
member.summary: Enable keeping a buffer with the decoded frames

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.DecodedFramesBufferSize
member.summary: Max size of the Decoded Frames Buffer

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.DecodedFramesBuffer
member.summary: Internal dictionary that implements the Decoded Frames Buffer, holding the decoded frames

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.isDecodedFramesBufferBlocked
member.summary: Whether the Decoded Frames Buffer can be written or not

member.name: F:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.frameBufferStreamNumber
member.summary: The stream number to take the frameBuffer

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.GetDecodedFrameAtTimestamp(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a Texture2D with the decoded frame at a given timestamp
member.remarks: If no frame matches the timestamp exactly, it will retrieve the frame immediately before.
member.param: The offset in milliseconds from the beginning of the media from which the decoded frame should be retrieved.
Whether to delete older frames from the Decoded Frames buffer. Default: true
member.returns: The texture 2D of the requested frame, or null if the frame is not available for the given timestamp

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.GetDecodedFramesBufferRange
member.summary: Retrieves the range of the Decoded Frames Buffer in milliseconds
member.returns: A Vector2Int with the range in milliseconds (with the start at the X component and the end at the Y component), or Vector2Int.zero if the buffer is empty.

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.RemoveFramesFromDecodedBufferOlderThan(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes all the frames from the Decoded Frames Buffer that have a timestamp older (smaller) than the given timestamp

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.ClearDecodedFramesBuffer
member.summary: Destroys all Texture2D in the Decoder frame buffer and then clears it

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.GetNetworkBandwidth
member.summary: Returns the current network bandwidth. This value is just an estimation in kbps.
member.returns: The current network bw in kbps

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.SetMinBufferDurationInMs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the minimum duration of media that the player will attempt to ensure is buffered at all times, in milliseconds. NOTE: THIS METHOD MUST BE CALLED BEFORE SETTING UP THE PLAYER
member.param: The minimum buffer duration in milliseconds

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.SetMaxBufferDurationInMs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum duration of media that the player will attempt to buffer, in milliseconds. NOTE: THIS METHOD MUST BE CALLED BEFORE SETTING UP THE PLAYER
member.param: The maximum buffer duration in milliseconds

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.SetPlaybackBufferInMs(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the duration of media that must be buffered for playback to start or resume following a user action such as a seek, in milliseconds. NOTE: THIS METHOD MUST BE CALLED BEFORE SETTING UP THE PLAYER
member.param: The initial playback buffer duration in milliseconds

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.DisableABR(System.Int32)
member.summary: Disables the ABR to prevent the player from changing tracks regardless of bandwidth.

member.name: M:HISPlayerAPI.HISPlayerInterface.EnableABR(System.Int32)
member.summary: Enables the ABR to change automatically between tracks
